titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: J. Robert Willson (1912-1994) was chair of the Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology at the University of Michigan Medical School from 1964 to 1978. Willson earned his M.D. from the University of Michigan in 1937 and completed his internship and residency in obstetrics and gynecology in 1942. He also held an M.S. in obstetrics and gynecology. He left the University in 1942 for a teaching position at Chicago Lying-In Hospital. He moved to Temple University School of Medicine in 1946 as a professor and chair of its OB/GYN department. Willson returned to the University of Michigan in 1964 as department chair. He retired in 1978 but continued as the Bates Professor of Diseases of Women and Children and professor of obstetrics and gynecology until 1983.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of J. Robert Willson. Materials include: records of operations (1948-1961); correspondence with colleagues, publishers, and professional organizations; printed material, including reprints, faculty and alumni directories and programs; manuscripts and printed copies of speeches, articles, and books; photographs of Willson, some with colleagues; appointment books (1949-1987); awards, certificates, and licenses; and anatomical illustrations.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
